headline: Mars’ $36bn takeover of Kellanova ‘faces scrutiny of EU regulators’
summary: An 18 June deadline has now passed for Mars to assuage EU competition concerns, raising speculation over the regulator’s next course of action.

raw.headline: Mars’ $36bn takeover of Kellanova ‘faces scrutiny of EU regulators’
raw.summary: An 18 June deadline has now passed for Mars to assuage EU competition concerns, raising speculation over the regulator’s next course of action.

headline: Mars Misses EU Deadline for Kellanova’s $30 Billion Deal Remedies
summary: The European Commission had not received by Wednesday’s deadline any remedies from Mars for its deal to take over the Pringles maker, which it agreed to buy last August.

raw.headline: Mars Misses EU Deadline for Kellanova’s $30 Billion Deal Remedies
raw.summary: The European Commission had not received by Wednesday’s deadline any remedies from Mars for its deal to take over the Pringles maker, which it agreed to buy last August.

headline: Mars has not offered remedies to EU for Kellanova deal, EU website shows
summary: BRUSSELS (Reuters) -Candy company Mars has not offered remedies to EU antitrust regulators reviewing its proposed $36-billion takeover of Pringles maker Kellanova, an update on the European Commission website showed on Thursday.  The deadline for Mars to offer remedies was June 18.  Mars and Kellanova did not immediately respond to emailed requests for comment.
